availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Vergennes, Vermont native. Daughter of Benejah Webster and Esther Bostwick. Teacher in Vergennes, Vermont in 1835.Established Lexington Female Academy in Lexington, Kentucky in 1843. Arrested with Calvin Fairbank in September 1844 on charges of "negro-stealing," or helping the enslaved Hayden family escape to freedom in Ohio. Sentenced to two years in the Kentucky penitentiary, but pardoned on February 24, 1845, and taught school in New York. Returned to Trimble County, Kentucky to run a farm and underground railroad station in 1854. Ordered to leave Kentucky and lost farm due to arson in 1866.

ab.bibl: The Kentucky Encyclopedia, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 939.
